questions.question_text: Solve: Check whether –2 and 2 are zeroes of the polynomial x + 2
questions.correct_answer: Answer should demonstrate understanding of polynomial with proper mathematical reasoning
questions.explanation: Refer to D:\Textbooks\Rationalised Textbooks 2022-23\0962-Mathematics\1 Source Files\Chapter-2\Chapter-2.pmd, page 6
questions.source_content: 30 MATHEMATICS Solution : (i) p(x) = 5x2 – 3x + 7 The value of the polynomial p(x) at x = 1 is given by p(1) = 5(1)2 – 3(1) + 7 = 5 – 3 + 7 = 9 (ii) q(y) = 3y3 – 4y + 11 The value of the polynomial q(y) at y = 2 is given by q(2) = 3(2)3 – 4(2) + 11 = 24 – 8 + 11 = 16 + 11 (iii) p(t) = 4t4 + 5t3 – t2...
questions.formula_used: x = 1 is given by p(1) = 5(1)2 – 3(1) + 7 = 5 – 3 + 7 = 9 (ii) q(y) = 3y3 – 4y + 11 The value of the polynomial q(y) at y = 2 is given by q(2) = 3(2)3 – 4(2) + 11 = 24 – 8 + 11 = 16 + 11 (iii) p(t) = 4t4 + 5t3 – t2 + 6 The value of the polynomial p(t) at t = a is given by p(a) = 4a4 + 5a3 – a2 + 6 Now, consider the polynomial p(x) = x – 1

questions.source_content: INTRODUCTION TO TRIGONOMETRY 123 As you know, for finding the trigonometric ratios, we need to know the lengths of the sides of the triangle.
